DEFINITION: Used to describe tumor samples that exhibit well to moderately well differentiated cells. They are generally expected to be slow growing and less aggressive.
A term referring to the degree of differentiation of a malignant neoplasm and indicating that it is moderately differentiated.
Used to describe tumor samples that exhibit poorly differentiated or undifferentiated cells. They are generally expected to be fast growing and aggressive.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
